SENT.plain: A case of coexisting moyamoya disease and craniopharyngioma in an 8-year-old boy is reported
The patient had been suffering from recurrence of transient right hemiparesis with headache and vomiting during the three years before admission

After the diagnosis of both moyamoya disease and craniopharyngioma, evacuation of the cystic fluid of the craniopharyngioma, encephalomyosynangiosis , and internal irradiation through an Ommaya drainage system were carried out
The symptoms gradually improved after these procedures
The relation of moyamoya disease to craniopharyngioma is discussed
We consider that internal irradiation is one of the best means of treatment for a cystic craniopharyngioma associated with moyamoya disease
